Or, at least, peak "responsible enough to worry about what happens if my scooter gets nicked" level. Let's talk insurance policies, because staring at those tiny fonts and legal jargon is basically everyone's idea of a rocking Friday night.

unnormalised: First up, life insurance. It’s basically betting against yourself. Morbid? Maybe. Smart? Definitely. Imagine, after years of yelling at the TV during cricket matches, you finally kick the bucket (hopefully not *because* of a cricket match, though). Your family gets a sweet payout. Consider it a "sorry I left you with my questionable Bollywood opinions" fund. Policies range from ₹5 lakh to ₹5 Cr, depending on how dramatic your send-off needs to be.

unnormalised: Then there's health insurance. Because, let's face it, the only thing predictable about your health is that it's going to throw you a curveball at the most inconvenient time. Like right before Diwali. Suddenly, appendicitis! The cost of treatment at Apollo Hospitals starts at around Rs. 50,000, but trust me, having insurance makes that bill a *lot* less painful than the actual surgery. Plus, you can finally use that “get well soon” bouquet your aunt gave you without feeling guilty about the price tag on the back.

unnormalised: Now, let’s not forget motor insurance. Because navigating Indian roads is basically an extreme sport. You're dodging cows, auto-rickshaws seemingly piloted by kamikaze pigeons, and that one uncle who thinks indicators are purely decorative. Getting comprehensive coverage of 75% is like wrapping your precious vehicle in a bubble of financial safety. And if that pigeon-piloted auto-rickshaw *does* manage to make contact? Well, at least your wallet won't need surgery too.

unnormalised: Home insurance! Imagine the sheer horror of realizing that the monsoon has decided your living room is actually a swimming pool. Or that your prized collection of Bollywood movie posters has become a soggy mess. Home insurance usually covers damages upto Rs. 20 lakhs, depending on your premium of course. It's like having a tiny army of repairmen on standby, ready to tackle whatever Mother Nature (or your plumbing) throws at you.

unnormalised: Travel insurance, folks. Essential. Especially if you're the kind who thinks "adventure" involves eating street food from questionable vendors. Getting stuck in Bangkok with Delhi Belly and a missing passport? Not ideal. Travel insurance for a 10-day trip to Thailand costs around Rs. 1,500. Think of it as your "get out of jail free" card for international mishaps. Plus, it covers lost luggage, so you won't have to explain to your family why you came back from Goa with only a sunburn and a single, slightly sandy flip-flop.

unnormalised: And remember, comparing policies is key. Don't just grab the first one you see like it's the last samosa at a party. Use online comparison tools like Policybazaar.com or Paisabazaar.com. They're like Tinder for insurance – swipe right until you find the policy that makes your heart (and wallet) flutter.

unnormalised: So, there you have it. Insurance: because sometimes, life throws more than just *chai* at you. It throws medical bills, car accidents, and monsoon floods.
